metadata.title: CVE-2017-7244 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
The _pcre32_xclass function in pcre_xclass.c in libpcre1 in PCRE 8.40allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (invalid memory read)via a crafted file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7244` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libpcre16-3 - 2:8.38-3.1ubuntu0.1~esm2
libpcre3 - 2:8.38-3.1ubuntu0.1~esm2
libpcre32-3 - 2:8.38-3.1ubuntu0.1~esm2
libpcrecpp0v5 - 2:8.38-3.1ubuntu0.1~esm2
pcregrep - 2:8.38-3.1ubuntu0.1~esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: pcre3 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:8.38-3.1ubuntu0.1~esm2').
